sentence.Network_en: The old woman's halting steps revealed the feebleness of her constitution.
sentence.Network_cn: 老人家蹒跚的脚步显出她体质衰弱.

sentence.Network_en: The course of the restructure includes feebleness, differentiation, transformation, aggrandizement and legalization.
sentence.Network_cn: 重构政府公共权力包括政府权力的弱化 、 分化 、 转化 、 强化以及法制化等过程.

sentence.Network_en: It is us making all the arrangements, our feebleness empowering the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的安排的始作俑者是我们自身,是我们的孱弱假手于时光这权力.

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being weak in health or body (especially from old age)
2. the quality of lacking intensity or substance;

sentences.sentence: "a shrill yet sweet tenuity of voice"- Nathaniel Hawthorne
